params._amount: This is the number of outcome tokens purchased
params._outcome: The outcome(s) which a user is buying tokens for. Note: This is the integer representation for the bit array.

returns._price: The cost to purchase _amount number of tokens

params._ct: The address for the deployed conditional tokens contract
params._token: Which ERC-20 token will be used to purchase and redeem outcome tokens for this condition

onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,u.details: Handles the receipt of a multiple ERC1155 token types. This function is called at the end of a `safeBatchTransferFrom` after the balances have been updated. To accept the transfer(s), this must return `bytes4(keccak256("onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,uint256[],uint256[],bytes)"))` (i.e. 0xbc197c81, or its own function selector).

params.data: Additional data with no specified format
params.from: The address which previously owned the token
params.ids: An array containing ids of each token being transferred (order and length must match values array)
params.operator: The address which initiated the batch transfer (i.e. msg.sender)
params.values: An array containing amounts of each token being transferred (order and length must match ids array)

onERC1155Received(address,address,uint25.details: Handles the receipt of a single ERC1155 token type. This function is called at the end of a `safeTransferFrom` after the balance has been updated. To accept the transfer, this must return `bytes4(keccak256("onERC1155Received(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)"))` (i.e. 0xf23a6e61, or its own function selector).

params.data: Additional data with no specified format
params.from: The address which previously owned the token
params.id: The ID of the token being transferred
params.operator: The address which initiated the transfer (i.e. msg.sender)
params.value: The amount of tokens being transferred

params._numOutcomes: The number of different outcomes available _subsidyToken Which ERC-20 token will be used to purchase and redeem outcome tokens for this condition
params._oracle: The address for the EOA/contract which will act as the oracle for this condition
params._overround: How much 'profit' does the AMM claim? Note that this is represented in bips. Therefore inputting 300 represents 0.30%
params._questionId: The question ID (needs to be unique)
params._subsidy: How much initial funding is used to seed the market maker.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

buy(uint256,int128).notice: This function is used to buy outcome tokens.

cost().notice: View function returning the cost function.  This function returns the cost for this inventory state. It will be able  to tell you the total amount of collateral spent within the market maker.  For example, if a pool was seeded with 100 DAI and then a further 20 DAI  has been spent, this function will return 120 DAI.

cost_after_buy(uint256,int128).notice: This function will tell you the cost (similar to above) after a proposed transaction.

initialize(address,address).notice: Constructor like function for the market maker

price(uint256,int128).notice: This function tells you how much it will cost to make a particular trade.  It does this by calculating the difference between the current cost and the cost after the transaction.

setup(address,bytes32,uint256,uint256,ui.notice: Set up some of the variables for the market maker
